ygData.subject: Openglad 0.97
ygData.msgSnippet: One hour ago, Openglad 0.97 was released into the wild! This new version is a bugfix release, so anyone who had been having trouble with Openglad should

One hour ago, Openglad 0.97 was released into the wild! This new version
is a bugfix release, so anyone who had been having trouble with Openglad
should upgrade to this.

The list of changes for this version is:

  - The plugging of an extremely nasty memory leak (that could leak a meg
    every few minutes) in the foe finding code. As far as I can tell, that
    leak has been in the code ever since the foe finding code was written,
    which would make this a pretty dang long-lived memory leak. Other
    sizable leaks were plugged too, but I forgot the details on those.
  - For those who had trouble with fullscreen in Windows, it should
    hopefully work now. For once, the windows binaries were released at
    the same time as the Linux ones, so you can go ahead and try it out
    whenever you want. There is still no working joystick support for
    Windows, and as soon as I can get USB configured in my Windows
    emulator prog, I'll get to working on that.
  - A long list of crashes was fixed, too long to remember :-)
  - File finding code was improved. It properly checks the current
    directory now.
  - All the required files are now included in the distribution (this
    should fix the missing DLL errors some windows users were having).
    The docs are also in there.

The new release can be downloaded from http://snowstorm.sourceforge.net,
or through the project site (http://sourceforge.net/projects/snowstorm).
This time, the source comes in both tar.gz and zip format, so Windows
users can use the .zip without making WinZip choke on the tar.gz format.
There is a makefile for VC in case anyone wants to work on the source code
a bit. Openglad can be compiled by executing "nmake /f Makefile.vc" in the
src/ directory.

It is very well possible that the fixes messed up working stuff, so if
anyone finds any bugs whatsoever (there are no known ones at the time of
this writing), please submit a bug report (at
https://sourceforge.net/tracker/?group_id=50083&atid=458515).

That's that for Openglad 0.97. Most of the changes I noted above were done
in the last 4 days or so. Over the last few months, me and Sean have been
working on Openglad Enhanced. We're currently working on cleaning up the
code to make the whole thing easier to work with, and as soon as school
lays off a bit, we'll be able to go at a much quickker pace, so hopefully
there will be great things for Openglad in the future.


That's it for now. Enjoy the new release!

- Yan
